page.title: 08WATER SUPPLIES FROM ULLEY
page.content:
{
Water enters Ulley Reservoir from Ulley Brook. This starts at Morthen as Morthen Brook. It is piped under the M1 and M18 link roads where the name changes to Ulley Brook. This runs through fields and a gentle valley until it enters the reservoir. The reservoir is in the Yorkshire Water Authorities Don Valley catchment area.The dam was constructed in 1874 to supply water to nearby Whiston and Rotherham.It contains 582 thousand cubic metres of water,is 10.3 metres deep and has an area of 12 Hectares. The water was treated by filtering through sand in a 'Slow sand filter' and disinfecting it with Chlorine.When in full use the amount treated was 0.2 thousand cubic metres per day. Water is only taken in a real emergency.
